row.title: Drugs Approved for Head and Neck Cancer
row.field_short_title: Drugs Approved for Head and Neck Cancer
row.field_page_description: This page lists cancer drugs approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for head and neck cancer. The list includes generic names and brand names. The drug names link to NCI’s Cancer Drug Information summaries.

row.title: Eribulin Improves Survival of Women with Metastatic Breast Cancer
row.field_short_title: Eribulin Improves Survival of Women with Metastatic Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: Treatment with eribulin (Halaven™) improved overall survival in women with metastatic breast cancer whose disease progressed despite multiple rounds of prior chemotherapy, according to the results of a phase III clinical trial called EMBRACE.
row.field_feature_card_description: Treatment with eribulin (Halaven™) improved overall survival in women with metastatic breast cancer whose disease progressed despite multiple rounds of prior chemotherapy, according to the results of a phase III clinical trial called EMBRACE.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Stomach (Gastric) Cancer
row.field_page_description: This page lists cancer drugs approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for stomach (gastric) cancer. The list includes generic names and brand names. The drug names link to NCI's Cancer Drug Information summaries.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Vulvar Cancer
row.field_page_description: This page lists cancer drugs approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for vulvar cancer. The list includes generic names and brand names. The drug names link to NCI's Cancer Drug Information summaries.

row.title: Emergency Resources for the Cancer Community
row.field_short_title: Emergency Resources for the Cancer Community
row.field_page_description: Information to help prepare for an emergency. Includes resources to continue cancer care, to prepare and update NCI employees and contractors, and NCI contacts for grantees.
row.field_feature_card_description: Resources for patients and health care providers to continue cancer care, and information for NCI grantees and staff.
row.field_list_description: Information to help prepare for an emergency. Includes resources for patients and health care providers to continue cancer care, NCI contacts for grantees, and resources to prepare and update NCI employees and contractors.
row.field_browser_title: Emergency Resources for the Cancer Community

row.title: Study Shows Aspirin Reduces Colorectal Cancer in Those at High Risk
row.field_short_title: Study Shows Aspirin Reduces Colorectal Cancer in Those at High Risk
row.field_page_description: Findings from the first large clinical trial of its kind indicate that taking high doses of aspirin daily for at least 2 years substantially reduces the risk of colorectal cancer among people at increased risk of the disease.
row.field_feature_card_description: Findings from the first large clinical trial of its kind indicate that taking high doses of aspirin daily for at least 2 years substantially reduces the risk of colorectal cancer among people at increased risk of the disease.

row.title: Cervical Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Cervical cancer is the fourth most common cancer in women worldwide. The primary risk factor for cervical cancer is human papillomavirus (HPV) infection. Start here to find evidence-based information on cervical cancer treatment, causes and prevention, screening, research, and statistics.
row.field_feature_card_description: When caught early, cervical cancer is very treatable. Learn about risk factors and treatment.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about cervical cancer.

row.title: Harms of Cigarette Smoking and Health Benefits of Quitting
row.field_short_title: Harms of Cigarette Smoking and Health Benefits of Quitting
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that lists some of the cancer-causing chemicals in tobacco smoke and describes the health problems caused by cigarette smoking and the benefits of quitting.
row.field_feature_card_description: Get the facts about the health problems caused by cigarette smoking and the benefits of quitting.

row.title: HIV Infection and Cancer Risk
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that describes the increased risk of certain types of cancer by people infected with HIV.
row.field_feature_card_description: Persons with HIV are at increased risk of certain types of cancer. Learn more from this fact sheet, including ways to lower the risk or find cancer early.
row.field_list_description: A fact sheet that describes the increased risk of certain types of cancer by people infected with HIV. These cancers include Kaposi sarcoma, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphoma, and cancers of the anus, cervix, liver, and lung. Also describes what people with HIV infection can do to lower their risk of cancer or find cancer early.

row.title: Treatment Regimen Extends Survival for Women with Cervical Cancer
row.field_short_title: Treatment Extends Survival for Women with Cervical Cancer
row.field_page_description: Patients with locally advanced cervical cancer who received gemcitabine (Gemzar®) both as part of initial treatment and as part of therapy following primary treatment had improved survival compared with patients whose treatment did not include gemcitabine, according to findings presented at the 2009 ASCO meeting in

row.title: Thyroid Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: There are four main types of thyroid cancer: papillary (the most common), follicular, medullary, and anaplastic. The four types differ in how aggressive they are. Start here to find information on thyroid cancer treatment, screening, research, and statistics.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about thyroid cancer.

row.title: PDQ® Cancer Information Summaries: Prevention
row.field_page_description: Risk factors and methods to increase chances of preventing specific types of cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Can you lower your risk of getting cancer? Learn more from our evidence-based information summaries.

row.title: Find NCI-Supported Clinical Trials
row.field_feature_card_description: Find an NCI-supported clinical trial—and learn how to locate other research studies—that may be right for you or a loved one.

row.title: FDA Terminology
row.field_page_description: FDA works with NCI EVS to develop regulatory and other controlled terminology standards.
row.field_feature_card_description: FDA works with NCI EVS to develop regulatory and other controlled terminology in several areas. Some 15,000 terms are stored in NCIt.
row.field_list_description: U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) works with NCI EVS to develop regulatory and other controlled terminology in several areas. Some 15,000 terms are stored in NCI Thesaurus (NCIt).

row.title: NCPDP Terminology
row.field_page_description: NCPDP Terminology developed with NCI EVS for prescription drugs.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCPDP works with NCI to provide standard terminology for transfer of data related to medications, supplies, and services within the healthcare system.
row.field_list_description: National Council for Prescription Drug Programs (NCPDP) works with NCI to provide standard terminology for transfer of data related to medications, supplies, and services within the healthcare system.

row.title: Ruth L. Kirschstein National Research Service Award (NRSA) for Individual Postdoctoral Fellows (F32)
row.field_page_description: For postdoctoral candidates or mentored junior faculty who have Ph.D.s and are pursuing careers in basic science.

row.title: NCI Outstanding Investigator Award (R35) Frequently Asked Questions
row.field_page_description: Frequently asked questions for the NCI Outstanding Investigator Award.
row.field_feature_card_description: Frequently asked questions for the NCI Outstanding Investigator Award.

row.title: Contact the Office of Budget and Finance
row.field_page_description: Address and phone number for NCI's Office of Budget and Finance.

row.title: RAS Structural Biology
row.field_page_description: The RAS Structural Biology group determines the structures of RAS proteins, alone and in complex with important effectors.
row.field_feature_card_description: This group aims to provide structural insights into oncogenic mutants of RAS, RAS-effector, and RAS-interactor complexes.
row.field_list_description: This group aims to provide structural insights into oncogenic mutants of RAS, RAS-effector, and RAS-interactor complexes.

row.title: Advocacy Announcements and Resources
row.field_page_description: Get updates from the Office of Advocacy Relations (OAR) and find resources for cancer research advocates.
row.field_feature_card_description: Updates from OAR and a list of NCI resources for cancer research advocates.

row.title: What We Do
row.field_page_description: To advance global cancer research, build expertise, improve cancer prevention and cancer screening in low to middle income countries (LMICs), and reduce cancer deaths worldwide, CGH facilitates research efforts through collaboration with U.S. government agencies, foreign governments, non-government organizations, and p
row.field_feature_card_description: CGH advances global cancer research to reduce cancer deaths worldwide

row.title: Patient Advocate Steering Committee
row.field_page_description: The Patient Advocate Steering Committee (PASC) works to ensure advocates involved with the Scientific Steering Committees (SSCs) are completely integrated in the development, implementation, and monitoring of clinical trials within those groups.
row.field_feature_card_description: The PASC works to ensure advocates involved with SSCs are completely integrated in the development, implementation, and monitoring of clinical trials within those groups.
row.field_list_description: The PASC works to ensure advocates involved with SSCs are completely integrated in the development, implementation, and monitoring of clinical trials within those groups.

row.title: Center for Global Health Seminar Series
row.field_short_title: Center for Global Health Seminar Series

row.title: Enzalutamide Improves Survival in Patients with Metastatic Prostate Cancer
row.field_short_title: Enzalutamide Improves Survival in Patients with Metastatic Prostate Cancer
row.field_page_description: A summary of results from an international phase III trial that compared enzalutamide (Xtandi®) and placebo for the treatment of metastatic prostate cancer that had progressed during treatment with androgen deprivation therapy.
row.field_feature_card_description: In an international randomized phase III clinical trial, the hormone therapy enzalutamide (Xtandi®) extended survival in men with metastatic prostate cancer that had progressed during treatment with androgen deprivation therapy. Participants in the trial
row.field_list_description: In an international randomized phase III clinical trial, the hormone therapy enzalutamide (Xtandi®) extended survival in men with metastatic prostate cancer that had progressed during treatment with androgen deprivation therapy. Participants in the trial had not received chemotherapy.
row.field_browser_title: Enzalutamide Improves Survival in Patients with Metastatic Prostate Cancer

row.title: How to Work With Your Health Insurance Plan
row.field_short_title: How to Work With Your Health Insurance Plan
row.field_page_description: Insurance plans may cover some costs of taking part in a clinical trial. Learn who to contact for help, questions to ask, and the types of information to collect.
row.field_browser_title: Work with Insurance to Pay for Clinical Trials

row.title: About the Office of Grants Administration
row.field_short_title: About the Office of Grants Administration
row.field_page_description: OGA supports grants and cooperative agreements awarded to scientific institutions, small businesses, and individuals to help build, maintain, and enhance a cohesive and comprehensive cancer research agenda. Learn more about OGA and its program structure.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn about OGA’s program structure and how the office helps build, maintain, and enhance a cohesive and comprehensive cancer research agenda.
row.field_list_description: OGA supports grants and cooperative agreements, helping to build, maintain, and enhance a cohesive and comprehensive cancer research agenda. Learn more about OGA, including program structure and responsibilities.

row.title: OGA Staff
row.field_page_description: We are a team of over 60 grants specialists, team leaders, and branch chiefs who work together to help financially support cancer research activities throughout the United States and around the world.

row.title: New Awards in NCI’s Cancer Systems Biology Consortium
row.field_short_title: New Awards in NCI’s Cancer Systems Biology Consortium
row.field_page_description: Announcement that NCI awarded four new grants in the Cancer Systems Biology Consortium (CSBC).
row.field_feature_card_description: Research in cancer systems biology will focus on the analysis of cancer as a complex biological system.
row.field_list_description: The National Cancer Institute awarded four new grants in NCI’s Cancer Systems Biology Consortium (CSBC). The institutions receiving Center grants are: Arizona State University, Harvard Medical School, University of California-Irvine, and Vanderbilt University.
row.field_browser_title: New Grants Awarded in Cancer Systems Biology Consortium - CSBC

row.title: RAS Initiative Events
row.field_page_description: The NCI RAS Initiative has organized multiple events with outside experts to discuss how the latest scientific and technological breakthroughs can be applied to discover vulnerabilities in RAS-driven cancers.
row.field_feature_card_description: The RAS Initiative has organized multiple events with outside experts to discuss how the latest scientific and technological breakthroughs can be applied to discover vulnerabilities in RAS-driven cancers.
row.field_list_description: A fundamental aspect of scientific research is to enable and encourage the exchange of information and ideas through in-person workshops and meetings. The NCI RAS Initiative has organized multiple events with invited outside experts to discuss how the latest scientific and technological breakthroughs can be applied to discover vulnerabilities in cancers caused by mutant RAS genes.

row.title: Track 1: Oncology Product Research and Review for M.D. Oncology Fellows
row.field_short_title: IOTF: Oncology Product Review for Oncology Fellows
row.field_page_description: NCI and FDA collaborate to train physicians in clinical trials methodology and medical product development. Learn more about this cancer training program.
row.field_feature_card_description: Training for physicians in clinical aspects of medical product development.
row.field_list_description: This interagency program trains physicians in aspects of clinical trials methodology and analysis, epidemiology, clinical aspects of medical product development to facilitate the movement of products from basic bench science to commercialization.
row.field_browser_title: Oncology Product Research and Review for M.D. Oncology Fellows

row.title: Track 2: Oncology Product Research and Review for Board Certified Oncologists
row.field_short_title: IOTF: Oncology Product Review for BC Oncologists
row.field_page_description: NCI and FDA collaborate to train physicians in aspects of drug, biologic, or device development and standards for assessing medical product safety. Learn more about this cancer training program.
row.field_feature_card_description: Training for physicians in aspects of medical product development and standards.
row.field_list_description: This interagency program trains physicians in aspects of drug, biologic, or device development and standards for assessing medical product safety and efficacy to facilitate movement from basic bench science to commercialization.
row.field_browser_title: Oncology Product Research and Review for B.C. Oncologists

row.title: Intramural Investigators Submitting Data
row.field_page_description: Find general requirements for intramural investigators submitting genomic data. Different processes may exist based on operational differences in NCI intramural research programs.
row.field_browser_title: GDS Policy - Intramural Investigators Submitting Data

row.title: Center for Cancer Genomics Research
row.field_page_description: NCI’s Center for Cancer Genomics aims to transform the diagnosis and treatment of cancer through structural, functional, and computational genomics research, and the promotion of data sharing.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn about CCG’s programs and collaborations, which study the molecular basis of cancer through structural, functional, and computational genomics research.
row.field_list_description: CCG studies cancer through structural, functional, and computational genomics, and promotes data sharing. The Genome Characterization Pipeline transforms tissue samples into rich, publicly available data that fuel innovation by the research community.

row.title: Connect with Screen to Save
row.field_page_description: Join NCI community health educators and partners in helping to increase colorectal cancer screenings among men and women age 50–75 from racially and ethnically diverse communities and in rural areas.
row.field_feature_card_description: Join NCI community health educators and partners in helping to increase colorectal cancer screening rates in communities that need it most.
row.field_browser_title: CRCHD - Connect with Screen to Save

row.title: Functional Genomics Research
row.field_page_description: NCI's Center for Cancer Genomics uses functional genomics to understand the impact of cancer genes and pathways, and how to target them effectively.
row.field_feature_card_description: Functional genomics studies the role of particular cancer genes and pathways, and develops therapeutic strategies to target them. CCG's related research includes the Cancer Target Discovery and Development Network and the Human Cancer Models Initiative.
row.field_list_description: Functional genomics studies the role of particular cancer genes and pathways, and develops therapeutic strategies to target them. CCG's functional genomics research includes the Cancer Target Discovery and Development Network and the Human Cancer Models Initiative.
row.field_browser_title: Functional Genomics Research - Center for Cancer Genomics

row.title: Cancer Clinical Trials at the National Institutes of Health Clinical Center
row.field_short_title: Cancer Clinical Trials at the NIH Clinical Center
row.field_page_description: Information about cancer clinical trials at the NIH Clinical Center in Bethesda, Maryland.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI trials in Bethesda, Maryland, aim to solve important problems in cancer research and patient care.
row.field_browser_title: Cancer Clinical Trials at the NIH Clinical Center

row.title: Cancer Moonshot℠ Research Initiatives
row.field_page_description: Implementation teams are considering multiple ways to fund new programs as well as expansions of ongoing efforts to advance the goals of the Cancer Moonshot.

row.title: NCI HIV and AIDS Research Coordinated by OHAM
row.field_short_title: NCI HIV/AIDS Research Coordinated by OHAM
row.field_page_description: NCI scientists have made a number of critical contributions to HIV/AIDS research since the beginning of the AIDS epidemic. Learn more about intramural and extramural research supported by NCI.
row.field_feature_card_description: Scientists working at NCI campuses conduct an active research program in HIV/AIDS malignancies, and NCI supports extramural research focused on HIV/AIDS.
row.field_list_description: An active research program in HIV/AIDS and HIV malignancies is conducted by scientists working at the NCI campuses in Bethesda, Rockville, and Frederick, Maryland. In addition, extramural research focused on HIV malignancies is supported by the NCI.
row.field_browser_title: OHAM – AIDS Research Activities at NCI

row.title: 2014 Social Media Events
row.field_page_description: Find past social media events involving NCI and its partners from 2014.
row.field_feature_card_description: Find past social media events involving NCI and its partners from 2014.

row.title: AIDS and Cancer Specimen Resource
row.field_page_description: The AIDS Cancer Specimen Resource (ACSR) is a biorepository for HIV-infected human biospecimens. Learn how ACSR encourages pivotal understanding of the epidemic and its impact on cancer incidence.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn how ACSR encourages pivotal study of the HIV/AIDS epidemic and its impact on cancer incidence.
row.field_list_description: The AIDS Cancer Specimen Resource (ACSR) is a biorepository for HIV-infected human biospecimens and associated clinical information. Learn how ACSR encourages pivotal understanding of the HIV/AIDS epidemic and its impact on cancer incidence.
row.field_browser_title: OHAM – AIDS and Cancer Specimen Resource

row.title: Clinical Trial Sequencing Project
row.field_page_description: The Clinical Trial Sequencing Project performs genomic characterization of samples from NCI-sponsored trials with the goal of improving the understanding and treatment of various cancers.
row.field_browser_title: Clinical Trial Sequencing - CCG Structual Genomics Research

row.title: National Cancer Institute Overview and Mission
row.field_page_description: Learn about the National Cancer Institute and what we do, our impact, and our future plans.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn about who we are, what we do, and our future plans.
row.field_list_description: Learn about who we are, what we do, and our future plans.

row.title: Funding for Extramural Cancer Training by the Cancer Training Branch
row.field_page_description: Find funding for training grants, fellowships, research career development awards, and education research grants for students and scientists at universities and institutions across the country.
row.field_feature_card_description: Find funding for training grants, fellowships, research career development awards, and education research grants for students and scientists at universities and institutions across the country.

row.title: NCI Dictionary of Cancer Terms
row.field_page_description: NCI's Dictionary of Cancer Terms provides easy-to-understand definitions for words and phrases related to cancer and medicine.
row.field_feature_card_description: Look up easy-to-understand definitions for words and phrases related to cancer and medicine.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Thyroid Cancer
row.field_page_description: This page lists cancer drugs approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for thyroid cancer. The list includes generic names and brand names.

row.title: Mentored Clinical Scientist Research Career Development Award (K08)
row.field_page_description: For postdoctoral candidates or mentored junior faculty are pursuing careers in basic science.

row.title: Inclusion Criteria for NCI Cancer Genetics Services Directory
row.field_short_title: Inclusion Criteria for NCI Cancer Genetics Services Directory
row.field_page_description: Professionals who provide services related to cancer genetics (cancer risk assessment, genetic counseling, genetic susceptibility testing, and others) must meet these criteria before applying to be listed in the National Cancer Institute's Cancer Genetics Services Directory.

row.title: Long-Term Data from 20 Trials Confirm Tamoxifen’s Long-Lasting Benefit
row.field_short_title: Long-Term Data from 20 Trials Confirm Tamoxifen's Long-Lasting Benefit
row.field_page_description: Women with estrogen receptor-positive breast cancer who received about 5 years of adjuvant tamoxifen had a lower risk of recurrence in the 15 years after treatment than women who did not receive tamoxifen.
row.field_feature_card_description: Women with estrogen receptor-positive breast cancer who received about 5 years of adjuvant tamoxifen had a lower risk of recurrence in the 15 years after treatment than women who did not receive tamoxifen.
row.field_list_description: In an analysis of data from participants in 20 clinical trials, women with estrogen receptor-positive breast cancer who received about 5 years of adjuvant treatment with tamoxifen had a lower risk of recurrence in the 15 years after starting treatment than women who did not receive tamoxifen.

row.title: Radiation Therapy after Breast-Conserving Surgery Improves Survival
row.field_short_title: Radiation Therapy after Breast-Conserving Surgery Improves Survival
row.field_page_description: Radiation therapy after breast-conserving surgery substantially reduces the risk of cancer recurring in the breast and moderately reduces the risk of death from the disease.
row.field_feature_card_description: Radiation therapy after breast-conserving surgery substantially reduces the risk of cancer recurring in the breast and moderately reduces the risk of death from the disease.
row.field_list_description: Radiation therapy after breast-conserving surgery substantially reduces the risk of cancer recurring in the breast and moderately reduces the risk of death from the disease, according to updated results from a meta-analysis by the Early Breast Cancer Trialists' Collaborative Group.

row.title: Two Drugs that Hit One Target Improve Survival in Women with Metastatic Breast Cancer
row.field_short_title: Targeted Drug Combination Improves Survival in Women with Metastatic Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: Combining two drugs that target the HER2 protein, trastuzumab (Herceptin®) and pertuzumab, with chemotherapy may be a new treatment option for women with HER2-positive metastatic breast cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Combining two drugs that target the HER2 protein, trastuzumab (Herceptin®) and the investigational agent pertuzumab, with chemotherapy may be a new treatment option for women with HER2-positive metastatic breast cancer.
row.field_list_description: Combining two drugs that target the HER2 protein, trastuzumab (Herceptin®) and pertuzumab, with chemotherapy is a new treatment option for women with HER2-positive metastatic breast cancer, according to final results from a large clinical trial.
row.field_browser_title: Combining Targeted Drugs Effective for Metastatic Breast Cancer

row.title: Additional Surgery after Breast-Conserving Surgery Varies Widely
row.field_short_title: Additional Surgery after Breast-Conserving Surgery Varies Widely
row.field_page_description: A study published in the Feb. 1, 2012, issue of JAMA found that the number of women who have one or more additional surgeries to remove suspected residual tumor tissue (re-excisions) following breast-conserving surgery (BCS) for breast cancer varies widely across surgeons and hospitals.

row.title: Combining Chemotherapy with Bevacizumab Improves Outcomes for Ovarian Cancer Patients
row.field_short_title: Combining Chemotherapy with Bevacizumab Improves Outcomes for Ovarian Cancer Patients
row.field_page_description: Results from two phase III randomized clinical trials suggest that, at least for some patients with ovarian cancer, adding the antiangiogenesis agent bevacizumab to chemotherapy increases the time to disease progression and may improve survival.
row.field_feature_card_description: Results from two phase III randomized clinical trials suggest that, at least for some patients with ovarian cancer, adding the antiangiogenesis agent bevacizumab to chemotherapy increases the time to disease progression and may improve survival.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Ovarian, Fallopian Tube, or Primary Peritoneal Cancer
row.field_short_title: Drugs Approved for Ovarian, Fallopian Tube, or Primary Peritoneal Cancer
row.field_page_description: This page lists cancer drugs approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for ovarian cancer. The list includes generic names, brand names, and common drug combinations, which are shown in capital letters. The drug names link to NCI's Cancer Drug Information summaries.

row.title: New Therapies Offer Valuable Options for Patients with Melanoma
row.field_short_title: New Therapies Offer Valuable Options for Patients with Melanoma
row.field_page_description: Two phase III clinical trials of new therapies for patients with metastatic melanoma presented in June at the 2011 ASCO conference confirmed that vemurafenib and ipilimumab (Yervoy™) offer valuable new options for the disease.
row.field_feature_card_description: Two phase III clinical trials of new therapies for patients with metastatic melanoma presented in June at the 2011 ASCO conference confirmed that vemurafenib and ipilimumab (Yervoy™) offer valuable new options for the disease.
row.field_list_description: Two phase III clinical trials of new therapies for patients with metastatic melanoma presented in June at the 2011 ASCO conference confirmed that the molecularly targeted agent vemurafenib and the immunotherapy agent ipilimumab (Yervoy™) offer valuable new options for a disease in which effective treatments have been lacking.

row.title: Exemestane Reduces Breast Cancer Risk in High-Risk Postmenopausal Women
row.field_short_title: Exemestane Reduces Breast Cancer Risk in High-Risk Postmenopausal Women
row.field_page_description: Clinical trial results presented at the 2011 ASCO annual meeting showed that the aromatase inhibitor exemestane—used to treat early and advanced breast cancer—substantially reduced the risk of invasive breast cancer in high-risk postmenopausal women.
row.field_feature_card_description: Clinical trial results presented at the 2011 ASCO annual meeting showed that the aromatase inhibitor exemestane—used to treat early and advanced breast cancer—substantially reduced the risk of invasive breast cancer in high-risk postmenopausal women.
row.field_list_description: Clinical trial results presented at the 2011 ASCO annual meeting showed that the aromatase inhibitor exemestane (Aromasin®)—commonly used to treat early and advanced-stage breast cancer—substantially reduced the risk of invasive breast cancer in postmenopausal women at high risk of developing the disease.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Liver Cancer
row.field_page_description: This page lists cancer drugs approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for liver cancer. The list includes generic names and brand names. The drug names link to NCI’s Cancer Drug Information summaries.

row.title: Moving Beyond Breast Cancer Videos
row.field_page_description: Several breast cancer survivors discuss their journey and offer tips and advice to help cope with the challenges of recovery.

row.title: Study Suggests Smaller Melanoma Excision Margins May Be Option for Some Patients
row.field_short_title: Study Suggests Smaller Melanoma Excision Margins May Be Option for Some Patients
row.field_page_description: A randomized controlled trial of patients with stage IIA–C cutaneous melanoma thicker than 2-mm found that a 2-cm surgical resection margin is sufficient and is as safe for patients as a 4-cm margin.
row.field_feature_card_description: A randomized controlled trial of patients with stage IIA–C cutaneous melanoma thicker than 2-mm found that a 2-cm surgical resection margin is sufficient and is as safe for patients as a 4-cm margin.
row.field_list_description: A randomized controlled trial of patients with stage IIA–C cutaneous melanoma thicker than 2-mm found that a 2-cm surgical resection margin is sufficient and is as safe for patients as a 4-cm margin in terms of overall survival, according to a report published online October 21 in The Lancet.

row.title: Targeted Therapy Shows Benefit in Rare Type of Thyroid Cancer
row.field_short_title: Targeted Therapy Shows Benefit in Rare Type of Thyroid Cancer
row.field_page_description: Treatment with the multitargeted agent vandetanib (Caprelsa) improved progression-free survival in patients with medullary thyroid cancer (MTC), according to findings from a randomized clinical trial.
row.field_feature_card_description: Treatment with the multitargeted agent vandetanib (Caprelsa) improved progression-free survival in patients with medullary thyroid cancer (MTC), according to findings from a randomized clinical trial.

row.title: Questions to Ask Your Doctor When You Have Finished Treatment
row.field_short_title: Questions to Ask Your Doctor When You Have Finished Treatment
row.field_page_description: Suggested questions for cancer patients to ask their doctors after treatment is finished and they are planning for follow-up care and next steps.
row.field_feature_card_description: Suggested questions for cancer patients to ask their doctors after treatment is finished and they are planning for follow-up care and next steps.

row.title: Combining Angiogenesis-Targeted Treatments for Liver Cancer
row.field_short_title: Combining Angiogenesis-Targeted Treatments for Liver Cancer
row.field_page_description: In this trial, patients with unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma who are ineligible for a liver transplant or other local therapies will be given oral sorafenib at the standard approved dose and intravenous TRC105.
row.field_feature_card_description: In this trial, patients with unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma who are ineligible for a liver transplant or other local therapies will be given oral sorafenib at the standard approved dose and intravenous TRC105.

row.title: Study Suggests New Treatment Option for Some Lymphomas
row.field_short_title: Study Suggests New Treatment Option for Some Lymphomas
row.field_page_description: Updated findings from a large European clinical trial indicate that patients with some types of lymphoma could initially be treated with the chemotherapy drug bendamustine (Treanda) and the targeted agent rituximab (Rituxan).
row.field_feature_card_description: Updated findings from a large European clinical trial indicate that patients with some types of lymphoma could initially be treated with the chemotherapy drug bendamustine (Treanda) and the targeted agent rituximab (Rituxan).

row.title: Redefining Adjuvant Therapy for Stage III Resected Colon Cancer
row.field_short_title: Redefining Adjuvant Therapy for Stage III Resected Colon Cancer
row.field_page_description: In this trial, patients with resected stage III colon cancer are being randomly assigned to receive FOLFOX chemotherapy for either 3 or 6 months and to take either a pill called celecoxib or a matching placebo pill for 3 years.
row.field_feature_card_description: In this trial, patients with resected stage III colon cancer are being randomly assigned to receive FOLFOX chemotherapy for either 3 or 6 months and to take either a pill called celecoxib or a matching placebo pill for 3 years.
row.field_list_description: In this trial, patients with resected stage III colon cancer are being randomly assigned to receive a type of chemotherapy called FOLFOX for either 3 months or 6 months and to take either an aspirin-like pill called celecoxib (Celebrex®) or a matching placebo pill for 3 years.
row.field_browser_title: Redefining Adjuvant Therapy for Colon Cancer

row.title: RAS Reagents
row.field_page_description: The RAS Reagents group prepares proteins, DNAs, and cell lines, all of which are required to attack cancers caused by mutant RAS.
row.field_feature_card_description: Attacking cancers caused by mutant RAS requires proteins, DNAs, and cell lines prepared by this group.
row.field_list_description: Attacking cancers caused by mutant RAS requires proteins, DNAs, and cell lines prepared by this group.

row.title: More Research Is Needed on What Patients Being Treated for Cancer Should Eat
row.field_page_description: An article about the need for new research on the optimal nutrition for patients being treated for cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: An article about the need for new research on the optimal nutrition for patients who have been treated for cancer.
row.field_list_description: A survey of online recommendations shows there is a need for more research on the optimal nutritional approaches for patients being treated for cancer.
row.field_browser_title: Diet during Cancer Treatment Research Update

row.title: Radium-223 Improves Survival in Patients with Advanced Prostate Cancer
row.field_page_description: A summary of results from a phase III trial that compared radium-223 dichloride plus the best standard of care versus a placebo plus the best standard of care in men with metastatic, castration-resistant prostate cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Results from a phase III trial show that radium-223 dichloride (Xofigo®) improves overall survival in men with advanced prostate cancer that has spread to their bones compared with placebo.
row.field_list_description: Results from a phase III trial show that radium-223 dichloride (Xofigo®) improves overall survival in men with advanced prostate cancer that has spread to their bones compared with placebo.

row.title: Preventing Stomach Cancer: The Link to H. pylori Bacteria
row.field_short_title: The Link to H. pylori Bacteria
row.field_page_description: NCI supported research to solidify the link between H. pylori infections and stomach cancer. As a result, new cancer treatment and prevention strategies are being developed, encouraging scientists to carefully examine other cancers for viral and bacterial connections.
row.field_browser_title: Discovery – The Link to H.Pylori Bacteria

row.title: About the Office of Advocacy Relations
row.field_page_description: OAR works with cancer research advocates and organizations to ensure the advocacy community's perspectives and ideas are integrated into NCI activities to advance research.
row.field_list_description: OAR links NCI and the advocacy community to communicate NCI priorities and ensure appropriate involvement of research advocates in Institute activities to advance research.
row.field_browser_title: About the Office of Advocacy Relations (OAR)

row.title: Blocking DNA Repair in Advanced BRCA-Mutated Cancer
row.field_short_title: Blocking DNA Repair in Advanced BRCA-Mutated Cancer
row.field_page_description: In this trial, patients with relapsed or refractory advanced cancer and confirmed BRCA mutations who have not previously been treated with a PARP inhibitor will be given BMN 673 by mouth once a day in 28-day cycles.
row.field_feature_card_description: In this trial, patients with relapsed or refractory advanced cancer and confirmed BRCA mutations who have not previously been treated with a PARP inhibitor will be given BMN 673 by mouth once a day in 28-day cycles.

row.title: NCI and Medical Decision Making
row.field_page_description: NCI conducts and facilitates basic and translational research that can inform standard clinical practice and medical decision making.

row.field_list_description: Information on NCI's role in support of medical decision making.

row.title: Treatment of Solid Tumor Cancers with the Chemotherapy Drug Methotrexate
row.field_page_description: Prior to the 1950s, treatment for the majority of cancers was limited to either surgery or the use of radiation. The discovery of the use of methotrexate in curing a rare cancer marked the first time a cancer had been cured. This led to the development of many of today’s common cancer treatments.
row.field_browser_title: Discovery – Methotrexate: Chemotherapy Treatment for Cancer

row.title: Aspirin to Reduce Cancer Risk
row.field_page_description: A federal advisory panel supports aspirin to reduce the risk of colorectal cancer, while researchers are investigating whether it may help reduce the risk of other cancers.
row.field_feature_card_description: Aspirin may reduce colorectal cancer risk, but what about other cancers?
row.field_list_description: Even as a federal advisory panel has supported the use of aspirin to reduce the risk of colorectal cancer in some people, researchers are investigating how aspirin works against cancer and whether it may help reduce the risk of other cancers.
row.field_card_title: Aspirin May Help to Reduce Cancer Risk

row.title: Center for Global Health Staff
row.field_page_description: Contact information for NCI's Center for Global Health leadership and staff. CGH is a collaborative team of over 40 cancer researchers, scientists, and communication experts.
row.field_feature_card_description: Find CGH's leadership, US-based, and offsite staff names and emails.
row.field_list_description: The Center for Global Health is a collaborative team of over 40 cancer researchers, scientists, and communication experts. Find contact information for CGH leadership and staff.

row.title: Ibrutinib Improves Survival Compared with Ofatumumab in Patients with Previously Treated Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia
row.field_short_title: Ibrutinib Improves Survival in Patients with Previously Treated Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia
row.field_page_description: A summary of results from an international phase III trial that compared ibrutinib (Imbruvica®) and ofatumumab (Arzerra®) for the treatment of relapsed or refractory chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) or small lymphocytic lymphoma (SLL).
row.field_feature_card_description: In an international randomized phase III clinical trial, patients with relapsed or refractory chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) or small lymphocytic lymphoma (SLL) who were treated with ibrutinib (Imbruvica®) lived longer without their disease getting wo
row.field_list_description: In an international randomized phase III clinical trial, patients with relapsed or refractory chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) or small lymphocytic lymphoma (SLL) who were treated with ibrutinib (Imbruvica®) lived longer without their disease getting worse than patients who received ofatumumab (Arzerra®). Patients who received ibrutinib also lived longer and were more likely to show a clinical response to treatment than those who received ofatumumab.
row.field_browser_title: Ibrutinib Improves Survival in Patients with Previously Treated Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia

row.title: RAS Tools and Resources
row.field_page_description: Find RAS datasets, tools, and resources. You can also share your own tools with the community for further collaboration.
row.field_feature_card_description: Find databases that contain information on RAS and the RAS pathway, and news about the renewed attack on cancers caused by mutant RAS.
row.field_list_description: Find up-to-date RAS datasets, tools, and resources. You can also share your own tools with the community for further collaboration.

row.title: Understanding “Chemobrain” and Cognitive Impairment after Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: An NCI research update about research to investigate what factors play a role in “chemobrain” or cognitive impairment after cancer treatment.
row.field_feature_card_description: Researchers are investigating factors that might predict who’s at risk and how to lessen its impact.
row.field_list_description: Researchers are investigating factors that might predict who’s more at risk for experiencing “chemobrain” after cancer treatment and what can be done to lessen its impact.

row.title: Funding for Global Research and Training
row.field_short_title: Funding for Global Research and Training

row.title: CGH Short Term Scientist Exchange Program (STSEP)
row.field_short_title: CGH Short Term Scientist Exchange Program (STSEP)
row.field_page_description: STSEP promotes collaborative research between established U.S. and foreign scientists from low, middle, and upper-middle income countries (LMICs) by supporting, in part, exchange visits of cancer researchers between U.S. and foreign laboratories.
row.field_feature_card_description: STSEP promotes collaborative research between established U.S. and foreign scientists from LMICs by supporting exchange visits of cancer researchers between U.S. and foreign laboratories.

row.title: Contact The Center for Global Health
row.field_page_description: The CGH U.S. offices is located at 9609 Medical Center Drive, Rockville, MD 20892.

row.title: Head and Neck Steering Committee
row.field_page_description: The Head and Neck Steering Committee addresses the design, prioritization and evaluation of concepts for phase II and phase III clinical trials in adult head and neck cancers.
row.field_feature_card_description: The Head and Neck Steering Committee evaluates and prioritizes concepts for phase 3 and large phase 2 therapeutic clinical trials.
row.field_list_description: The Head and Neck Steering Committee evaluates and prioritizes concepts for phase 3 and large phase 2 therapeutic clinical trials to be conducted in the NCI National Clinical Trials Network (NCTN).

row.title: Trial of Pembrolizumab for HIV-Positive Patients with Recurrent or Refractory Cancer
row.field_short_title: Pembrolizumab for HIV-Positive Patients with Recurrent or Refractory Cancer
row.field_page_description: In this phase I clinical trial, HIV-positive patients receiving combination antiretroviral therapy who have cancer that has recurred after or has not responded to previous treatment will receive the immune checkpoint inhibitor pembrolizumab.
row.field_feature_card_description: HIV-positive patients receiving combination antiretroviral therapy who have cancer that has recurred after or has not responded to previous treatment will receive pembrolizumab.
row.field_browser_title: Pembrolizumab for HIV-Positive Patients with Recurrent or Refractory Cancer
row.field_card_title: Pembrolizumab for HIV-Positive Patients with Recurrent or Refractory Cancer

row.title: Delirium and Cancer Treatment
row.field_short_title: Diagnosing and Treating Delirium in Cancer Patients
row.field_page_description: Delirium is a confused mental state. Symptoms may include changes in thinking and sleeping. In cancer patients, it may be caused by medicine, dehydration, or happen at the end of life. Delirium may be mistaken for depression or dementia.
row.field_list_description: Delirium during cancer treatment is explained, including what causes it and how it is treated. Hypoactive delirium, hyperactive delirium, and mixed delirium are explained. Questions to ask your family member's doctor are also included.

row.title: Special Research Programs
row.field_page_description: Research Programs from NCI's Division of Cancer Biology - PS-ON, CSBC, TMEN, OMF, BETRNet, KRAS, MCL, TEC
row.field_feature_card_description: Special research programs from NCI's Division of Cancer Biology.
row.field_list_description: Special research programs from NCI's Division of Cancer Biology.

row.title: Care for Childhood Cancer Survivors
row.field_page_description: Survivorship care for children who have been treated for cancer is important. Get your child's treatment summary, survivorship plan, and recommendations on follow-up care clinics. Learn about long-term and late effects.
row.field_feature_card_description: Get your child's treatment summary, survivorship plan, and recommendations on follow-up care.
row.field_browser_title: Coping - Care for Childhood Cancer Survivors

row.title: Cancer Systems Biology Consortium
row.field_page_description: The CSBC looks at the changing cancer ecosystem, allowing researchers to understand and predict how one alteration effects an entire tumor system.
row.field_feature_card_description: The CSBC looks to understand changes in the overall cancer ecosystem.
row.field_list_description: The Cancer Systems Biology Consortium seeks to provide a bird’s eye view of the changing cancer ecosystem, allowing cancer biologists and oncologists to understand and predict how one alteration effects an entire tumor system.

row.title: Identifying Novel Drug Combinations to Overcome Treatment Resistance
row.field_short_title: Drug Combinations to Overcome Treatment Resistance
row.field_page_description: A review of current research identifying and testing drug combination approaches that have the potential to overcome or delay resistance to cancer treatment.
row.field_feature_card_description: Scientists are exploring drug combinations to overcome treatment resistance.
row.field_list_description: Drug resistance is a common occurrence that can lead to tumor relapse and patient death. Scientists are exploring combinations of different cancer drugs that have the potential to kill more cancer cells and overcome or delay drug resistance.
row.field_browser_title: Drug Combinations to Overcome Treatment Resistance
row.field_card_title: What Can Be Done When Cancer Treatment Stops Working?

row.title: Selected Publications by Dr. Doug Lowy
row.field_page_description: In these selected published articles, Douglas R. Lowy, M.D., Deputy Director of the National Cancer Institute (NCI), presents some of his work in cancer research.

row.title: Examining the Effects of Presurgical Treatment for Prostate Cancer
row.field_short_title: Effects of Presurgical Treatment for Prostate Cancer
row.field_page_description: In this study, men diagnosed with androgen-sensitive prostate cancer with intermediate- or high-risk features will be examined with mpMRI, undergo targeted biopsies, and be treated with neoadjuvant androgen deprivation therapy.
row.field_feature_card_description: In this study, men diagnosed with androgen-sensitive prostate cancer with intermediate- or high-risk features will be examined with mpMRI, undergo targeted biopsies, and be treated with neoadjuvant androgen deprivation therapy.

row.field_page_description: ALCHEMIST represents three integrated, precision medicine trials that are designed to identify people with early-stage lung cancer who have tumors that harbor certain uncommon genetic changes and evaluate whether drug treatments targeted against those mol
row.field_list_description: ALCHEMIST represents three integrated, precision medicine trials that are designed to identify people with early-stage lung cancer who have tumors that harbor certain uncommon genetic changes and evaluate whether drug treatments targeted against those molecular changes can lead to improved survival

row.field_page_description: Learn about Douglas R. Lowy, M.D., Deputy Director of the National Cancer Institute. His research interests include the biology of papillomaviruses and the regulation of normal and neoplastic cell growth.

row.field_page_description: Approval from NIH may be required before a cancer research grant recipient makes budget modifications or undertakes particular activities. Learn how to request approval.

row.field_list_description: The recipient institution is permitted some flexibility for rebudgeting between budget categories, but some actions require prior approval from the NCI. Requests must be submitted at least 30 days before the proposed change.

row.field_short_title: Menopausal Estrogen Therapy Benefits and Risks Vary by Age, WHI Analysis Suggests
row.field_page_description: Long-term follow-up data from the Women’s Health Initiative (WHI) provide new information about the potential risks and benefits of hormone therapy to treat symptoms related to menopause, including its effect on breast cancer risk,
row.field_feature_card_description: Long-term follow-up data from the Women’s Health Initiative (WHI) provide new information about the potential risks and benefits of hormone therapy to treat symptoms related to menopause, including its effect on breast cancer risk,
row.field_list_description: Long-term follow-up data from the Women’s Health Initiative (WHI) provide important new information about the potential risks and benefits of hormone therapy to treat symptoms or conditions related to menopause, including its effect on breast cancer risk, according to results published April 5, 2011, in the Journal of the American Medical Association.

row.title: Five Years of Tamoxifen Continues to Benefit Women 15 Years after Treatment
row.field_short_title: Five Years of Tamoxifen Continues to Benefit Women 15 Years after Treatment
row.field_page_description: In a large randomized clinical trial, women with early-stage breast cancer who received 5 years of adjuvant treatment with tamoxifen had better outcomes up to 15 years after the start of treatment than those who received 2 years of tamoxifen therapy.
row.field_feature_card_description: In a large randomized clinical trial, women with early-stage breast cancer who received 5 years of adjuvant treatment with tamoxifen had better outcomes up to 15 years after the start of treatment than those who received 2 years of tamoxifen therapy.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Myeloproliferative Neoplasms
row.field_page_description: This page lists cancer drugs approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for myeloproliferative neoplasms. The list includes generic names, brand names, and common drug combinations, which are shown in capital letters. The drug names link to NCI's Cancer Drug Information summaries.

row.title: Small Intestine Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Small intestine cancer usually begins in an area of the intestine called the duodenum. This cancer is rarer than cancers in other parts of the gastrointestinal system, such as the colon and stomach. Explore the links on this page to learn more about small intestine cancer treatment, statistics, research, and clinical t
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about Small Intestine Cancer.

row.title: Penile Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Penile cancer usually forms on or under the foreskin. Human papillomavirus (HPV) causes about one-third of penile cancer cases. When found early, penile cancer is usually curable. Start here to find information on penile cancer treatment and research.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about Penile Cancer.

row.title: Statins and Cancer Prevention
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet about results from animal research and ongoing observational studies of people taking statins that suggest that these drugs may lower the risk of certain cancers.
row.field_list_description: A fact sheet about results from animal research and ongoing observational studies of people taking statins that suggest that these drugs may lower the risk of certain cancers, including colorectal and skin cancers.

row.title: Anal Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Anal cancer cases have been increasing over several decades. Infection with human papillomavirus (HPV) is the major risk factor for anal cancer. Start here to find information on anal cancer treatment, causes and prevention, research, and statistics.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about anal cancer.

row.title: Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Information on cancer treatment methods, specific anticancer drugs, and drug development and approval. Research updates, cancer treatment facilities, and other topics also covered.
row.field_feature_card_description: Information about types of treatment, side effects, clinical trials, drugs, research updates, and more.
row.field_list_description: Learn about the different types of cancer treatment, including clinical trials.

row.title: Site Map
row.field_page_description: Site map for the National Cancer Institute website.
row.field_list_description: Site map for the National Cancer Institute website (www.cancer.gov).

row.title: Bladder Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: The most common type of bladder cancer is transitional cell carcinoma, also called urothelial carcinoma. Smoking is a major risk factor for bladder cancer. Bladder cancer is often diagnosed at an early stage. Start here to find information on bladder cancer treatment, screening, research, and statistics.
row.field_feature_card_description: Our evidence-based information covers treatment, causes, screening, and more.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about Bladder Cancer.

row.title: Pituitary Tumors—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Pituitary tumors are usually not cancer and are called pituitary adenomas. They grow slowly and do not spread. Rarely, pituitary tumors are cancer and they can spread to distant parts of the body. Start here to find information on pituitary tumors treatment.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about Pituitary Tumor.

row.title: Cancer in Children and Adolescents
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet about statistics, types, causes, and treatment of childhood cancers in the United States.

row.title: Professional Resources for Cancer Patient Education
row.field_page_description: Information about the NCI listserv for cancer patient educators, and the Cancer Patient Education Network.

row.title: Leukemia—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Leukemia is a broad term for cancers of the blood cells. The type of leukemia depends on the type of blood cell that becomes cancer and whether it grows quickly or slowly. Start here to find information on leukemia treatment, research, and statistics.
row.field_list_description: Information about leukemia treatment, clinical trials, research, statistics, and other topics.

row.title: Garlic and Cancer Prevention
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that summarizes the results of studies on the consumption of garlic for cancer prevention.

row.title: Radon and Cancer
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet about radon, an odorless radioactive gas, and its possible association with cancer, and how to test for radon in the home.
row.field_feature_card_description: A fact sheet about radon, an odorless radioactive gas, and its possible association with cancer, and how to test for radon in the home.

row.title: Lung Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: The two main types of lung cancer are non-small cell lung cancer and small cell lung cancer. Smoking causes most lung cancers, but nonsmokers can also develop lung cancer. Start here to find information on lung cancer treatment, causes and prevention, screening, research, and statistics on lung cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Smoking causes most lung cancers, but nonsmokers can also develop lung cancer.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about lung cancer.

row.title: Esophageal Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: The most common types of esophageal cancer are adenocarcinoma and squamous cell carcinoma. These forms of esophageal cancer develop in some parts of the esophagus and are driven by genetic changes. Start here to find information on esophageal cancer treatment, causes and prevention, screening, research, and statistics.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about esophageal cancer.

row.title: Coping with Cancer
row.field_page_description: Information for patients, families, and caregivers to help manage emotional and lifestyle effects of cancer, treatment, and life after treatment.
row.field_feature_card_description: Supportive information on managing the physical and emotional effects of cancer and treatment for both patients and caregivers.
row.intro:
You may have just learned that you have cancer. Or you may be in treatment, finishing treatment, or have a friend or family member with cancer. Having cancer changes your life and the lives of those around you. The symptoms and side effects of the disease and its treatment may cause certain physical changes, but they can also affect the way you feel and how you live.

The information in this section is meant to help you cope with the many issues and concerns that occur when you have cancer. There are resources available to help you learn about the disease and about the people who can help you. See our publications on coping and our evidence-based PDQ® summaries about supportive and palliative care topics. Know that you are not alone.

row.title: The ALTTO Breast Cancer Trial
row.field_page_description: A collection of material about the Adjuvant Lapatinib And/Or Trastuzumab Treatment Optimisation, or ALTTO, study that will compare the targeted agents lapatinib and trastuzumab alone, in sequence, or in combination as adjuvant therapy for HER2-positive br
row.field_list_description: A collection of material about the Adjuvant Lapatinib And/Or Trastuzumab Treatment Optimisation, or ALTTO, study that will compare the targeted agents lapatinib and trastuzumab alone, in sequence, or in combination as adjuvant therapy for HER2-positive breast cancer.

row.title: Second HPV Vaccine Shows Early Positive Results
row.field_short_title: Second HPV Vaccine Shows Early Results
row.field_page_description: The vaccine Cervarix® was 90 percent effective against two types of human papillomavirus (HPV) that can cause cervical cancer, according to the June 30, 2007, Lancet.
row.field_list_description: The vaccine Cervarix® was 90 percent effective against two types of human papillomavirus (HPV) that can cause cervical cancer, according to the June 30, 2007, Lancet.

row.title: Subscribe to Cancer.gov RSS Feeds
row.field_page_description: Subscribe to NCI RSS feeds to get news releases, summaries of clinical trial results, NCI Fact Sheets, and other information.

row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that explains the step-by-step procedures of two types of transplantations used with high-dose chemotherapy, including their risks and benefits.
row.field_feature_card_description: A fact sheet that explains the step-by-step procedures of two types of transplantations used with high-dose chemotherapy, including their risks and benefits.

row.title: Acrylamide and Cancer Risk
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet about acrylamide and cancer risk.
row.field_feature_card_description: A fact sheet about acrylamide and cancer risk.
row.field_list_description: A fact sheet that reviews research about a possible connection between acrylamide and cancer risk. Acrylamide is a chemical that has been found in certain foods, with especially high levels in potato chips, French fries, and other foods produced by high-temperature cooking.

row.title: Retinoblastoma—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Retinoblastoma is a very rare childhood cancer that forms in the tissues of the retina. Most cases of retinoblastoma are not inherited, but some are, and children with a family history of the disease should have their eyes checked beginning at an early age. Start here to find information on retinoblastoma treatment.
row.field_list_description: NCI's gateway for information about Retinoblastoma.

row.field_feature_card_description: Read about major research initiatives NCI has developed to address high-priority issues for the cancer research community.

row.title: The NCI Intramural Research Program
row.field_page_description: The intramural research program supports projects conducted by scientists located at NCI.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI provides sustained support to scientists working in many urgent areas of cancer research.

row.title: Reproductive History and Cancer Risk
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that describes what is known about the relationship between pregnancy, miscarriage, abortion, fertility treatment and the risk of cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: A fact sheet that describes what is known about the relationship between pregnancy, miscarriage, abortion, fertility treatment and the risk of cancer.
row.field_list_description: A fact sheet that describes what is known about the relationship between pregnancy, miscarriage, abortion, fertility treatment, and the risks of breast, ovarian, and endometrial cancers.

row.title: Vitamin D and Cancer Prevention
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that summarizes the results of studies on vitamin D and cancer prevention. It includes information about dietary recommendations for vitamin D.
row.field_feature_card_description: A fact sheet that summarizes the results of studies on vitamin D and cancer prevention.

row.title: Low-Dose Radioactive Iodine Destroys Thyroid Tissue Left after Surgery
row.field_short_title: Low-Dose Radioactive Iodine Destroys Thyroid Tissue Left after Surgery
row.field_page_description: A low dose of radioactive iodine given after surgery for thyroid cancer destroyed (ablated) residual thyroid tissue as effectively as a higher dose, with fewer side effects and less exposure to radiation, according to two randomized controlled trials.
row.field_feature_card_description: A low dose of radioactive iodine given after surgery for thyroid cancer destroyed (ablated) residual thyroid tissue as effectively as a higher dose, with fewer side effects and less exposure to radiation, according to two randomized controlled trials.
row.field_list_description: A low dose of radioactive iodine given after surgery for thyroid cancer destroyed (ablated) residual thyroid tissue as effectively as a higher dose, with fewer side effects and less exposure to radiation, according to two European randomized controlled trials published May 3, 2012 in the New England Journal of Medicine.

row.title: Expanding the Playing Field: Immune-Based Therapy Shows Potential for Lung, Other Cancers
row.field_short_title: Expanding the Playing Field: Immune-Based Therapy Shows Potential for Lung, Other Cancers
row.field_page_description: Results from two early-phase clinical trials presented at the 2012 American Society of Clinical Oncology annual meeting provide further evidence that priming the immune system to attack tumors has potential as a treatment for certain cancers.
row.field_feature_card_description: Results from two early-phase clinical trials presented at the 2012 American Society of Clinical Oncology annual meeting provide further evidence that priming the immune system to attack tumors has potential as a treatment for certain cancers.

row.title: Clinical Trials and Translational Research Advisory Committee
row.field_short_title: Clinical Trials and Translational Research Advisory Committee
row.field_page_description: Clinical Trials and Translational Research Advisory Committee, CTAC, is an external oversight committee that advises NCI leadership on its clinical and translational research enterprises.
row.field_feature_card_description: CTAC advises NCI on its clinical and translational research enterprises.
row.field_list_description: Learn about CTAC, an external oversight committee that advises NCI leadership on its clinical and translational research enterprises.
row.field_card_title: Clinical Trials and Translational Research Advisory Committee

row.title: Drugs Approved for Pancreatic Cancer
row.field_page_description: This page lists cancer drugs approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for pancreatic cancer. The list includes generic names, brand names, and common drug combinations, which are shown in capital letters.

row.title: Sallie Rosen Kaplan (SRK) Postdoctoral Fellowship for Women Scientists
row.field_page_description: The SRK Fellowship is a highly competitive, unpaid, and annual, one-year program that provides additional mentoring opportunities, networking, seminars, and workshops to help prepare NCI’s female postdoctoral fellows for the competitive nature of the job market and help them remain in a biomedical research career.

row.title: Paul Calabresi Career Development Award for Clinical Oncology (K12)
row.field_page_description: Institutional award for postdoctoral candidates or mentored junior faculty who are clinical scientists pursuing careers in patient-oriented research.
row.field_feature_card_description: Institutional award for postdoctoral candidates or mentored junior faculty who are clinical scientists pursuing careers in patient-oriented research.

row.title: Cancer Prevention, Control, Behavioral Sciences, and Population Sciences Career Development Award (K07)
row.field_page_description: For postdoctoral candidates or mentored junior faculty who are pursuing careers in cancer prevention, control, behavioral, and population sciences.

row.title: When Combined with Chemotherapy, Bevacizumab Is Associated with Increased Risk of Death
row.field_short_title: When Combined with Chemotherapy, Bevacizumab Is Associated with Increased Risk of Death
row.field_page_description: Cancer patients who receive the targeted therapy bevacizumab (Avastin) in combination with chemotherapy are at increased risk of serious side effects that may lead to death, according to a meta-analysis of 16 clinical trials that was published February 2,
row.field_feature_card_description: Cancer patients who receive the targeted therapy bevacizumab (Avastin) in combination with chemotherapy are at increased risk of serious side effects that may lead to death, according to a meta-analysis of 16 clinical trials that was published February 2,
row.field_list_description: Cancer patients who receive the targeted therapy bevacizumab (Avastin) in combination with chemotherapy are at increased risk of serious side effects that may lead to death, according to a meta-analysis of 16 clinical trials that was published February 2, 2011, in JAMA.

row.title: PSA Velocity Does Not Improve Prostate Cancer Detection
row.field_short_title: PSA Velocity Does Not Improve Prostate Cancer Detection
row.field_page_description: A rapid increase in prostate-specific antigen (PSA) levels is not grounds for automatically recommending a prostate biopsy, according to a study published online February 24, 2011, in the Journal of the National Cancer Institute.
row.field_feature_card_description: A rapid increase in prostate-specific antigen (PSA) levels is not grounds for automatically recommending a prostate biopsy, according to a study published online February 24, 2011, in the Journal of the National Cancer Institute.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma
row.field_page_description: A list of cancer drugs approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for non-Hodgkin lymphoma. The list includes generic names, brand names, and common drug combinations.

row.title: Adding Targeted Therapy to Treatment for Esophageal Cancer
row.field_short_title: Adding Targeted Therapy to Treatment for Esophageal Cancer
row.field_page_description: In this phase III clinical trial, people with confirmed HER2-positive locally advanced esophageal cancer will be randomly assigned to receive preoperative radiation therapy and chemotherapy, with or without trastuzumab.
row.field_feature_card_description: In this phase III clinical trial, people with confirmed HER2-positive locally advanced esophageal cancer will be randomly assigned to receive preoperative radiation therapy and chemotherapy, with or without trastuzumab.
row.field_list_description: In this phase III clinical trial, people with confirmed HER2-positive locally advanced esophageal cancer will be randomly assigned to receive preoperative radiation therapy and chemotherapy, with or without trastuzumab. Following surgery, patients assigned to the trastuzumab arm of the study will receive maintenance therapy with trastuzumab for 1 year.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Retinoblastoma
row.field_page_description: This page lists cancer drugs approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for retinoblastoma. The list includes generic names and brand names. The drug names link to NCI’s Cancer Drug Information summaries.

row.title: Cetuximab Combined with Oxaliplatin-Based Chemotherapy May Not Be Effective First-Line Treatment for Metastatic Colorectal Cancer
row.field_short_title: Cetuximab Plus Oxaliplatin May Not Be Effective Primary Treatment for Metastatic Colorectal Cancer
row.field_page_description: In a randomized phase III trial, the addition of the targeted therapy cetuximab to oxaliplatin and fluoropyrimidine chemotherapy did not prolong survival or time to disease progression of patients with advanced colorectal cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: In a randomized phase III trial, the addition of the targeted therapy cetuximab to oxaliplatin and fluoropyrimidine chemotherapy did not prolong survival or time to disease progression of patients with advanced colorectal cancer.
row.field_list_description: In a randomized phase III trial, the addition of the targeted therapy cetuximab to oxaliplatin and fluoropyrimidine chemotherapy did not prolong survival or time to disease progression of patients with advanced colorectal cancer. The results were published on June 5, 2011 in The Lancet.

row.title: Cell Phones and Cancer Risk
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that outlines the available evidence regarding use of cellular/mobile telephones and cancer risk.
row.field_feature_card_description: A fact sheet that outlines evidence about use of cellular/mobile telephones and cancer risk.
row.field_browser_title: Cell Phones and Cancer Risk Fact Sheet

row.title: Preventing Cervical Cancer: The Development of HPV Vaccines
row.field_short_title: Preventing Cervical Cancer with HPV Vaccines
row.field_page_description: Cervical cancer can be prevented with HPV vaccines. NCI-supported researchers helped establish HPV as a cause of cervical cancer. They also helped create the first HPV vaccines, were involved in the vaccine trials, and contribute to ongoing studies.

row.title: Global Health Events
row.field_page_description: CGH sponsors a number of global health events for both national and international audiences, focused on the open exchange of scientific knowledge.
row.field_feature_card_description: Discover the latest national and international events that focus on the open exchange of scientific knowledge.
row.field_list_description: Discover the latest national and international events that focus on the open exchange of scientific knowledge.

row.title: Lung Cancer Screening Saves Lives: The National Lung Screening Trial
row.field_page_description: NCI funded the National Lung Screening Trial, an eight-year study that used new technology to detect small, aggressive tumors early enough to surgically remove them. This approach reduced lung cancer deaths among participants by 20 percent.
row.field_browser_title: Discovery – Lung Cancer Screening Saves Lives: The NLST

row.title: NCI Affordable Cancer Technologies Program
row.field_page_description: CGH supports the development and validation of affordable technology to increase access to cancer prevention, screening, detection, diagnosis and treatment in LMICs.
row.field_feature_card_description: CGH supports the development and validation of low-cost technology to increase access to cancer prevention, screening, detection, diagnosis and treatment in LMICs.
row.field_list_description: CGH supports the development and validation of affordable technology to increase access to cancer prevention, screening, detection, diagnosis and treatment in LMICs, especially in rural areas with limited infrastructure.

row.title: Trans-NIH Regional Grant Writing & Scientific Peer Review Workshops
row.field_short_title: Trans-NIH Regional Grant Writing & Scientific Peer Review Workshops
row.field_page_description: The Trans-NIH Regional Grant Writing & Scientific Peer Review Workshops increase the participation of scientists from LMICs in the research grant process.
row.field_feature_card_description: The Trans-NIH Regional Grant Writing & Scientific Peer Review Workshops increase the participation of scientists from LMICs in the research grant process.
row.field_list_description: CGH organizes The Regional Grant Writing & Scientific Peer Review Workshops in coordination with several Institutes and Centers across NIH to increase the participation of scientists from LMICs in the research grant process; develop strategies for sustainable research support and collaborations; and use competitive research as a tool to address global health issues.

row.title: RAS Biochemistry and Biophysics

row.title: National Cancer Act of 1971
row.field_page_description: The National Cancer Act of 1971, signed into law by President Richard Nixon, established the National Cancer Institute in its current form.

row.title: Genomic Data Commons
row.field_page_description: The NCI Genomic Data Commons (GDC) is a unified cancer genomics knowledge base that promotes data sharing and facilitates precision medicine in oncology.
row.field_feature_card_description: This NCI-supported knowledge system for cancer genomic and clinical data fosters precision medicine in oncology.
row.field_list_description: NCI’s Genomic Data Commons (GDC) is a unified cancer genomics knowledge base that promotes sharing of genomic and clinical data between researchers and facilitates precision medicine in oncology.

row.title: PET-CT–Guided Surveillance May Reduce Need for Surgery in Some Patients with Advanced Head and Neck Cancer
row.field_short_title: PET-CT–Guided Surveillance May Reduce Need for Surgery in Some Patients with Advanced Head and Neck
row.field_page_description: Patients with advanced squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck who underwent PET-CT–guided surveillance had fewer operations but similar overall survival rates to those of patients who underwent planned neck dissection.
row.field_feature_card_description: Patients with advanced squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck who underwent PET-CT–guided surveillance had fewer operations but similar overall survival rates to those of patients who underwent planned neck dissection.
row.field_list_description: Patients with advanced squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck who underwent PET-CT–guided surveillance after chemoradiation had overall survival rates similar to those of patients who underwent planned neck dissection and chemoradiation. But PET-CT imaging resulted in fewer operations and was more cost-effective than neck dissection.
row.field_browser_title: PET-CT–Guided Surveillance of Head and Neck Cancers
row.field_card_title: Surveillance May Reduce Need for Surgery in Some Patients with Head and Neck

row.title: Clinical Trials Reporting Program
row.field_page_description: The Clinical Trials Reporting Program is a comprehensive database of all NCI-supported clinical trials.
row.field_feature_card_description: Find information about CTRP, a comprehensive database of all NCI-supported clinical trials.
row.field_list_description: A comprehensive database of all NCI-supported clinical trials. The database exists to identify gaps in clinical research and duplicative studies. CTRP helps prioritize and enhance patient accrual to trials by making physicians aware of relevant opportunities for participation in clinical trials.
row.field_browser_title: CCCT - CTRP - Clinical Trials Reporting Program

row.title: Managing Costs and Medical Information
row.field_page_description: People with cancer may face major financial challenges and need help dealing with the high costs of care. Cancer treatment can be very expensive, even when you have insurance. Learn ways to manage medical information, paperwork, bills, and other records.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn ways to manage healthcare information, paperwork, bills, and other records.
row.field_list_description: People with cancer and their families may face major financial challenges. Cancer treatment can be very expensive, even when you have insurance. Learn ways to manage and track tests and treatments, paperwork, bills, and other records.
